In May 2018, Jones graduated from UTEP.<ref name=tv5/>

In May 2018, Jones graduated from UTEP.<ref name=tv5/> On his off days, Jones enjoys going over to the Bosovic house for a good home cooked meal. He especially loves playing UNO with the Bosovic children, even if he loses most of the time. Above all, Jones's favorite part of hanging out with the Bosovic family is playing with Max the cat. These two are best friends like peanut butter and jelly.<ref name=":0" />

'''Aaron LaRae Jones''' (born December 2, 1994) is an [[American football]] [[running back]] for the [[Green Bay Packers]] of the [[National Football League]] (NFL). He played college football at [[UTEP Miners football|UTEP]] and was drafted by the Packers in the fifth round of the [[2017 NFL Draft]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.elpasotimes.com/story/sports/football/2017/04/26/utep-rusher-aaron-jones-pro-football-nfl-draft-running-back/100904948/ |title=For Aaron Jones it's not so much when but where |work=El Paso Times |access-date=October 10, 2018 }}</ref>

==Early years==

A son of two US Army seargent majors Alvin and Vurgess, Jones looked up to [[Emmitt Smith]], [[Percy Harvin]], and [[Tyrod Taylor]] growing up.<ref>[https://nypost.com/2020/01/10/packers-aaron-jones-on-beating-odds-despite-being-overlooked/ Packers’ Aaron Jones on beating odds despite being overlooked]</ref> He and his twin brother Alvin Jr. and siblings Xavier and Chelsirae moved around and lived in [[Germany]], Kentucky, Tennesse, Virginia, and near the Mexican border due to their parents' postings.<ref name=tv5>[https://tv5.espn.com/nfl/story/_/id/28446151/packers-back-aaron-jones-free-ready-run-opportunity Aaron Jones is finally free -- and ready for the playoffs]</ref>

Jones attended and played [[high school football]] for [[Burges High School (El Paso, Texas)|Burges High School]] in [[El Paso, Texas]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://kfoxtv.com/news/local/burges-coach-players-proud-of-aaron-jones-success-in-the-nfl |title=Burges coach, players proud of Aaron Jones' success in the NFL |last=De Leon |first=Gloria |date=October 9, 2017 |publisher=KFOX |access-date=March 4, 2018 }}</ref> He had a three-star composite rating from [[247Sports.com]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://247sports.com/Player/Aaron-Jones-23052/high-school-36710/ |title=Aaron Jones, Burges , athlete |website=247Sports  |access-date=February 1, 2019}}</ref> His father retired before his senior year and started a marketing company to jumpstart the recruiting process for his sons.<ref name=tv5/>

==College career==
Jones attended and played college football for the [[UTEP Miners football|UTEP Miners]] from 2013 to 2016 under head coach [[Sean Kugler]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.sports-reference.com/cfb/players/aaron-jones-6.html |title=Aaron Jones College Stats |website=College Football at Sports-Reference.com  |access-date=March 4, 2018}}</ref>

As a freshman, Jones played in nine games. In his collegiate debut, against [[2013 New Mexico Lobos football team|New Mexico]], he had 11 carries for 127 yards and two rushing touchdowns.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.sports-reference.com/cfb/boxscores/2013-09-07-texas-el-paso.html |title=New Mexico at Texas-El Paso Box Score, September 7, 2013 |website=College Football at Sports-Reference.com  |access-date=March 4, 2018}}</ref> On October 26, against [[2013 Rice Owls football team|Rice]], he had a season-high 186 rushing yards.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.sports-reference.com/cfb/boxscores/2013-10-26-rice.html |title=UTEP at Rice Box Score, October 26, 2013 |website=College Football at Sports-Reference.com  |access-date=March 4, 2018}}</ref> Overall, he finished the 2013 season with 811 rushing yards, four rushing touchdowns, and four receptions for 14 yards.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.sports-reference.com/cfb/players/aaron-jones-6/gamelog/2013/ |title=Aaron Jones 2013 Game Log |website=College Football at Sports-Reference.com  |access-date=March 4, 2018}}</ref>

As a sophomore, Jones played in 12 games. He started the 2014 season off with three strong performances. In the season opener, he had 237 rushing yards and three rushing touchdowns in a victory at [[2014 New Mexico Lobos football team|New Mexico]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.sports-reference.com/cfb/boxscores/2014-08-30-new-mexico.html |title=UTEP at New Mexico Box Score, August 30, 2014 |website=College Football at Sports-Reference.com  |access-date=March 4, 2018}}</ref> In the next game, a loss to [[2014 Texas Tech Red Raiders football team|Texas Tech]], he had 144 rushing yards and two rushing touchdowns.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.sports-reference.com/cfb/boxscores/2014-09-06-texas-el-paso.html |title=Texas Tech at Texas-El Paso Box Score, September 6, 2014 |website=College Football at Sports-Reference.com  |access-date=March 4, 2018}}</ref> One week later, against [[2014 New Mexico State Aggies football team|New Mexico State]], he had 168 rushing yards and two rushing touchdowns.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.sports-reference.com/cfb/boxscores/2014-09-13-texas-el-paso.html |title=New Mexico State at Texas-El Paso Box Score, September 13, 2014 |website=College Football at Sports-Reference.com  |access-date=March 4, 2018}}</ref> On November 15, against [[2014 North Texas Mean Green football team|North Texas]], he had 177 rushing yards and two rushing touchdowns in the win.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.sports-reference.com/cfb/boxscores/2014-11-15-texas-el-paso.html |title=North Texas at Texas-El Paso Box Score, November 15, 2014 |website=College Football at Sports-Reference.com  |access-date=March 4, 2018}}</ref> On November 29, against [[2014 Middle Tennessee Blue Raiders football team|Middle Tennessee State]], he had 147 rushing yards and a rushing touchdown to go along with a 72-yard touchdown reception in the victory.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.sports-reference.com/cfb/boxscores/2014-11-29-texas-el-paso.html |title=Middle Tennessee State at Texas-El Paso Box Score, November 29, 2014 |website=College Football at Sports-Reference.com  |access-date=March 4, 2018}}</ref> Overall, in the 2014 season, he finished with 1,321 rushing yards (then fourth in school history<ref name=MG />), 11 rushing touchdowns, 30 receptions, 293 receiving yards, and three receiving touchdowns.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.sports-reference.com/cfb/players/aaron-jones-6/gamelog/2014/ |title=Aaron Jones 2014 Game Log |website=College Football at Sports-Reference.com  |access-date=March 4, 2018}}</ref>

As a junior, Jones played in only two games due to suffering an ankle injury early in the season.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.elpasotimes.com/story/sports/college/utep/2015/09/15/uteps-aaron-jones-out-year/72311704/ |title=UTEP's Aaron Jones out for year |last=Bloomquist |first=Bret |date=September 15, 2015 |work=El Paso Times |access-date=March 4, 2018 }}</ref> On the year, he finished with 209 rushing yards, one rushing touchdown, 106 receiving yards, and one receiving touchdown.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.sports-reference.com/cfb/players/aaron-jones-6/gamelog/2015/ |title=Aaron Jones 2015 Game Log |website=College Football at Sports-Reference.com  |access-date=March 4, 2018}}</ref> 91 of those came on the longest rushing play in school history against Texas Tech.

As a senior, Jones played in 12 games. In his first game back from the ankle injury, he had 249 rushing yards and two rushing touchdowns in a win over [[2016 New Mexico State Aggies football team|New Mexico State]],<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.sports-reference.com/cfb/boxscores/2016-09-03-texas-el-paso.html |title=New Mexico State at Texas-El Paso Box Score, September 3, 2016 |website=College Football at Sports-Reference.com  |access-date=March 4, 2018}}</ref> then the third-most in school history.<ref name=MG /> On October 29, against [[2016 Old Dominion Monarchs football team|Old Dominion]], he threw a three-yard passing touchdown in the loss.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.sports-reference.com/cfb/boxscores/2016-10-29-texas-el-paso.html |title=Old Dominion at Texas-El Paso Box Score, October 29, 2016 |website=College Football at Sports-Reference.com  |access-date=March 4, 2018}}</ref> In the next game against Houston Baptist, he had 228 rushing yards and two rushing touchdowns.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.sports-reference.com/cfb/boxscores/2016-11-05-texas-el-paso.html |title=Houston Baptist at Texas-El Paso Box Score, November 5, 2016 |website=College Football at Sports-Reference.com  |access-date=March 4, 2018}}</ref> He followed that up with 229 rushing yards and two more rushing touchdowns in a loss at [[2016 Florida Atlantic Owls football team|Florida Atlantic]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.sports-reference.com/cfb/boxscores/2016-11-12-florida-atlantic.html |title=UTEP at Florida Atlantic Box Score, November 12, 2016 |website=College Football at Sports-Reference.com  |access-date=March 4, 2018}}</ref> In his finale collegiate game, a win over [[2016 North Texas Mean Green football team|North Texas]], he had 301 rushing yards and four rushing touchdowns,<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.sports-reference.com/cfb/boxscores/2016-11-26-texas-el-paso.html |title=North Texas at Texas-El Paso Box Score, November 26, 2016 |website=College Football at Sports-Reference.com  |access-date=March 4, 2018}}</ref> second only to [[Fred Wendt]]'s 326 yards in 1948 in school history.<ref name=MG>[https://s3.amazonaws.com/sidearm.sites/utepathletics.com/documents/2018/8/10/UTEPMediaGuide18.pdf 2018 UTEP Media Guide], p. 122-133</ref> Overall, he had eight carries of more than 40 yards<ref name=tv5/> and  finished his final collegiate season with 1,773 rushing yards, 17 rushing touchdowns, 28 receptions, 233 receiving yards, three receiving touchdowns, and one passing touchdown.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.sports-reference.com/cfb/players/aaron-jones-6/gamelog/2016/ |title=Aaron Jones 2016 Game Log |website=College Football at Sports-Reference.com  |access-date=March 4, 2018}}</ref>

This made Jones one of the most prolific players in UTEP Miners history. In terms of rushing yards, he had five of the school's top 12 games, and school-records of 17 games with 100+ yards rushing, and five with 200+ yards. He holds the record for most rushing yards in a career (4,114), season (1,773; also fifth his second year), and career yards per game (117.5) including the 2nd- and 6th-best seasons in school history (147.8 in 2016; 110.1 in 2014). He is second all-time with 33 rushing touchdowns, including the school's 3rd- and 7th-best seasons (17 in 2016; 11 in 2014). His 4,760 career all-purpose yards and 136.0 per game average are both second all-time, and included the school's fourth and eight-best seasons. He has three of the school's 10 longest rushing plays, including the record 91-yarder from his short junior season. His 240 career points scored is 4th all time, and 2nd among non-kickers.<ref name=MG />

==Professional career==

[[File:Aaron Rodgers (43962650635).jpg|thumb|Jones receiving a [[Toss play|toss]] from [[Aaron Rodgers]] in 2018]]
Jones was drafted by the [[Green Bay Packers]] in the fifth round, 182nd overall, in the [[2017 NFL Draft]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.packers.com/news-and-events/article-draft/article-1/The-Packers-take-UTEP-RB-Aaron-Jones-at-No-182/c508d697-34a6-4eb3-8f64-63867f003afc|title=The Packers take UTEP RB Aaron Jones at No. 182|date=April 29, 2017|work=Packers.com|access-date=April 30, 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170429233950/http://www.packers.com/news-and-events/article-draft/article-1/The-Packers-take-UTEP-RB-Aaron-Jones-at-No-182/c508d697-34a6-4eb3-8f64-63867f003afc|archive-date=April 29, 2017|url-status=dead}}</ref> He was the 19th running back selected in that year's draft.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/years/2017/draft.htm |title=2017 NFL Draft Listing |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com  |access-date=February 10, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/play-index/draft-finder.cgi?request=1&year_min=2017&year_max=2017&draft_slot_min=1&draft_slot_max=500&pick_type=overall&pos%5B%5D=rb&conference=any&show=all&order_by=default |title=Draft Finder Query Results |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com  |access-date=February 10, 2018}}</ref> He was signed to a contract on May 5, 2017.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180430234641/http://www.packers.com/news-and-events/article-press-release/article-1/Packers-sign-five-draft-picks-15-rookie-free-agents/59429000-4dd0-49bc-a103-9df1aef245a2|title=Packers sign five draft picks, 15 rookie free agents|date=May 5, 2017|work=Packers.com}}</ref>

===2017 season: Rookie year===
After injuries to [[Ty Montgomery]] and [[Jamaal Williams]], Jones came into the ''[[Thursday Night Football]]'' game against the [[2017 Chicago Bears season|Chicago Bears]] in Week 4. In the game, he had 13 carries for 49 yards and his first career rushing touchdown.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201709280gnb.htm |title=Chicago Bears at Green Bay Packers – September 28th, 2017 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com  |access-date=November 5, 2017}}</ref> In Week 5 against the [[2017 Dallas Cowboys season|Dallas Cowboys]], Jones tallied 19 carries for 125 yards. He also had one lone target, for a 9-yard gain. In the second quarter, Jones rushed up the middle for a seven-yard touchdown, which was the second touchdown of his career. In Week 7, against the [[2017 New Orleans Saints season|New Orleans Saints]], he had 17 carries for 131 yards and a touchdown.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/201710220gnb.htm |title=New Orleans Saints at Green Bay Packers – October 22nd, 2017 |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com  |access-date=November 5, 2017}}</ref> Overall, he finished his rookie season with 448 rushing yards (second on the team to fellow rookie Jamaal Williams, ninth among NFL rookies), a team-leading four rushing touchdowns, nine receptions, and 22 receiving yards.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/players/J/JoneAa00/gamelog/2017/ |title=Aaron Jones 2017 Game Log |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com  |access-date=March 4, 2018}}</ref>

===2018 season===
On July 3, 2018, Jones was suspended the first two games of the 2018 season for violating the NFL's Substance Abuse policy.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.nfl.com/news/story/0ap3000000939413/article/packers-rb-aaron-jones-suspended-two-games |title=Packers RB Aaron Jones suspended two games |last=Teope |first=Herbie |date=July 3, 2018 |publisher=National Football League |access-date=September 19, 2019}}</ref> On September 23, his first game back from his suspension, Jones rushed six times for 42 yards in a 31–17 loss to the [[2018 Washington Redskins season|Washington Redskins]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://packerswire.usatoday.com/2018/09/24/rb-aaron-jones-plays-17-snaps-lb-oren-burks-8-in-2018-debuts/ |title=RB Aaron Jones plays 17 snaps, LB Oren Burks 8 in 2018 debuts |last=Kruse |first=Zach |date=September 24, 2018 |work=USA Today |access-date=October 10, 2018 }}</ref> The following week, in a 22–0 win over the [[2018 Buffalo Bills season|Buffalo Bills]], he had 11 rushes for 65 yards and a touchdown.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.apnews.com/f597abbe2ec24415ade191ddf334d9a4 |title=Packers defense has Rodgers' back in 22–0 win over Bills |last=Armas |first=Genaro C. |date=October 1, 2018 |work=AP NEWS |access-date=October 10, 2018}}</ref> He took over the starting duties in Week 6, though he continued to share carries with Williams and Montgomery. By Week 9, he had enough rushes to qualify for the NFL leaderboards, and took over the top spot in yards-per-rush at 6.02.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://pfref.com/tiny/0aknw |title=Through Week 9, yards per rush, 2018 seasos |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com  |access-date=September 19, 2019}}</ref> On November 11, he had 15 carries for a career-high 145 yards and two rushing touchdowns in a 31–12 Week 10 victory over the [[2018 Miami Dolphins season|Miami Dolphins]]. The following week, he caught his first NFL receiving touchdown and ran for another in a 24–27 loss to [[2018 Seattle Seahawks season|Seattle]]. In Week 12, he scored his fifth touchdown in three games en route to 93 total yards against the [[2018 Minnesota Vikings season|Minnesota Vikings]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/players/J/JoneAa00.htm |title=Aaron Jones Career Game Log |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com  |access-date=February 1, 2019}}</ref> He suffered a knee injury in Week 15 and was placed on injured reserve on December 18, 2018.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.espn.com/nfl/story/_/id/25567742/green-bay-packers-put-rb-aaron-jones-knee-ir |title=Packers place Aaron Jones on IR with right knee injury |last=Demovsky |first=Rob |date=December 18, 2018 |publisher=ESPN |access-date=September 19, 2019}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.packers.com/news/packers-place-rb-aaron-jones-on-ir |title=Packers place RB Aaron Jones on IR |date=December 18, 2018 |website=Packers.com |access-date=September 19, 2019}}</ref> Overall, he finished the 2018 season with 728 rushing yards, eight rushing touchdowns, 26 receptions, 206 receiving yards, and one receiving touchdown.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/players/J/JoneAa00.htm |title=Aaron Jones 2018 Game Log |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com  |access-date=February 1, 2019}}</ref>

In his first two seasons, Jones' averaged 9 touches per game<ref name=tv5/> and a league-leading 5.5 yards per carry.<ref name=si>[https://www.si.com/nfl/packers/news/aaron-jones-monster-season Meet the Man Behind Aaron Jones’ Monster Season]</ref>

===2019 season===
In Week 2 against the [[2019 Minnesota Vikings|Minnesota Vikings]], Jones rushed 23 times for 116 yards and a touchdown as the Packers won 21–16.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.espn.com/nfl/recap?gameId=401128098 |title=Packers ride Rodgers' hot start to 21–16 win over Vikings |last=Jenkins |first=Keith |date=September 15, 2019 |website=ESPN.com |access-date=September 15, 2019 |agency=Associated Press}}</ref> In Week 3 against the [[2019 Denver Broncos|Denver Broncos]], Jones rushed 10 times for 19 yards and two touchdowns as the Packers won 27–16.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web |url=https://www.espn.com/nfl/recap?gameId=401127925 |title=Packers remain unbeaten with 27–16 win over Broncos |date=September 22, 2019 |website=ESPN.com |access-date=September 22, 2019 |agency=Associated Press}}</ref> During Week 5 against the [[2019 Dallas Cowboys|Dallas Cowboys]], Jones finished with 107 rushing yards, 75 receiving yards, and four touchdowns as the Packers won 34–24, earning him NFC Offensive Player of the Week.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.espn.com/nfl/recap?gameId=401128029 |title=Rodgers, Packers rule at home of Cowboys again in 34–24 win |date=October 6, 2019 |website=ESPN.com |access-date=October 6, 2019}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.nfl.com/news/story/0ap3000001063805/article/deshaun-watson-aaron-jones-among-players-of-the-week |title=Deshaun Watson, Aaron Jones among Players of the Week |last=Bergman |first=Jeremy |date=October 9, 2019 |website=National Football League}}</ref> During ''Sunday Night Football'' against the [[2019 Kansas City Chiefs|Kansas City Chiefs]] in Week 8, Jones finished with 13 carries for 67 rushing yards, seven catches for 159 receiving yards, and two receiving touchdowns touchdowns as the Packers won 31–24.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.espn.com/nfl/recap?gameId=401128073 |title=Rodgers, Jones star for Packers in 31–24 victory over Chiefs |date=October 27, 2019 |website=ESPN.com |access-date=October 27, 2019}}</ref>  He was named the NFC Offensive Player of the Week for his performance.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.nfl.com/news/story/0ap3000001071284/article/joey-bosa-nick-bosa-among-players-of-the-week |title=Joey Bosa, Nick Bosa among Players of the Week |last=Bergman |first=Jeremy |date=October 30, 2019 |website=National Football League |access-date=October 30, 2019}}</ref>
In Week 10 against the [[2019 Carolina Panthers|Carolina Panthers]], Jones rushed 13 times for 93 yards and three touchdowns in the 24–16 win.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.espn.com/nfl/recap?gameId=401127944 |title=Packers' Jones scores 3 TDs in 24–16 win over Carolina |date=November 10, 2019 |website=ESPN.com |access-date=November 10, 2019}}</ref> In Week 14 against the [[2019 Washington Redskins|Washington Redskins]], Jones rushed 16 times for 134 yards and a touchdown in the 20–15 win.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.espn.com/nfl/recap?gameId=401127916 |title=Aaron Jones leads Packers past Washington, 20–15 |date=December 8, 2019 |website=ESPN.com |access-date=December 8, 2019}}</ref> During a rematch with the Minnesota Vikings on ''[[Monday Night Football]]'' in Week 16, Jones highlighted a big play with a 56-yard touchdown run. Overall, he finished with 154 rushing yards and two touchdowns on 23 rushes<ref name=si /> as the Packers won 23–10.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.espn.com/nfl/recap?gameId=401127946 |title=Packers clinch NFC North with 23–10 win over Vikings |date=December 23, 2019 |website=ESPN.com |access-date=December 23, 2019 |agency=Associated Press}}</ref>
In Week 17 against the [[2019 Detroit Lions|Detroit Lions]], Jones rushed 25 times for 100 yards and caught two passes for 43 yards in the 23–20 win.  During the game, Jones played a career-high 75 snaps<ref name=si/> and surpassed 1,000 rushing yards for the first time in his career.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.espn.com/nfl/recap?gameId=401127983 |title=Packers barely beat Lions 23–20 to earn first-round bye |date=December 29, 2019 |website=ESPN.com |access-date=December 29, 2019 |agency=Associated Press}}</ref> In his 285 touches in the 2019 season, Jones finished with totals of 1,084 rushing yards and 16 rushing touchdowns to go along with 49 receptions for 474 receiving yards and three receiving touchdowns.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/players/J/JoneAa00/gamelog/2019/ |title=Aaron Jones 2019 Game Log |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com |language=en |access-date=2020-01-02}}</ref><ref name=si/>

In the Divisional Round of the playoffs against the [[Seattle Seahawks]], Jones rushed 21 times for 62 yards and 2 touchdowns during the 28–23 win. <ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.espn.com/nfl/recap?gameId=401131042 |title=Packers hold off Seahawks 28-23 to reach NFC title game |date=January 12, 2020|agency=Associated Press |website=www.espn.com |access-date=January 12, 2020}}</ref>

==Personal life==

In May 2018, Jones graduated from UTEP.<ref name=tv5/>  

==Legal troubles==
On November 20, 2017, Jones was cited for a traffic stop, an incident that occurred on October 1. The day the incident occurred, Jones was speeding at 79 MPH at a 55 MPH speed limit, and had possession of marijuana. Jones was arrested and charged with operating with a restricted controlled substance, operating without a valid license, and speeding.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.nfl.com/news/story/0ap3000000880287/article/packers-rb-aaron-jones-facing-charges-after-traffic-stop |title=Packers RB Aaron Jones facing charges after traffic stop |date=November 20, 2017 |publisher=National Football League |access-date=November 20, 2017}}</ref> Jones pleaded [[no contest]] to the charges and was fined for court costs and had his license suspended for six months.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.espn.com/nfl/story/_/id/22608504/packers-rb-aaron-jones-pleads-no-contest-marijuana-related-charge |title=Packers RB Aaron Jones pleads no contest to marijuana-related charge |last=Demovsky |first=Rob |date=February 28, 2018 |publisher=[[ESPN]] |access-date=November 5, 2018}}</ref>
